revision.text:
{{Wireless embedded system |brand=AMIT |model=MGB100 |fcc_date=11/30/2005 |is_manuf=No |availability=OEM |type=NAS,access point |fcc_id=PBLMGB100 |pwr_v=5 |pwr_amp=2 |pwr_conn=barrel |cpu1_brand=AMRISC |cpu1_model=20000 |fla1=4 |fla1_brand=Macronix |fla1_model=MX29LV320A |ram1=32 |ram1_brand=ICSI |ram1_model=IC42S16160 |expansion_if_types=USB 2.0,IDE (2.5") |expansion_usb_num=2 |wi1_chip1_brand=Ralink |wi1_chip1_model=RT2560 |wi1_chip2_brand=Ralink |wi1_802dot11_protocols=bg |wi1_ant_conn=RP-SMA |eth_cpu=true |eth_chip2_brand=IC+ |eth_chip2_model=IP101A |lan_speed=100M |lan_ports=1 |802dot11_protocols=bg |default_ch= }} ''Portable Wireless AP Storage'' [http://tintuc.no-ip.com/linux/tipps/mgb100/ Hacking MGB100]
Above link states the item was sold as.. *Level-One (WAP-0007) *Comet Labs (MGB100) *Conceptronic (CHD2WLANU) *Micronica (MGB100) *OvisLink (WMU-6000FS) *Safecom (SWSAPUR-5400) *SMC (SMCWAPS-G EU) *Pearl (PE6643) The device uses a IT8211F IDE controller. Mentioned in [https://openwrt.org/logs/openwrt.log.20060523 this OpenWrt chat log] (aka Pearl ConnecTec PE6643?) FCC manual shows the device with an IP of 192.168.123.254, OUI of 00:50:18 (also on FCC EUT's board MAC label), and SSID of MGB100.
